columns.text: In this problem, we will identify how much should our bank account have if, for the next three months, we want to withdraw $2,500 each quarter for the next four years to cover college expenses if the interest rate is 0.57% per quarter.

To determine the amount required in our bank account to achieve the goal, we will use the present value of an annuity formula. The present value of an annuity refers to the current value of future payments based on a specified period and interest rate.

The present value of an annuity can be calculated using the following formula:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Present Value of an Annuity} &=C\times\dfrac{1-\dfrac{1}{\left(1+r\right)^t}}{r}
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$C$, which represent the cash amount\
$r$, which refers to the rate\
$t$, which symbolizes the period

In determining the present value of an annuity, therefore we will consider the following details from the problem:

| Particulars   |         |
|---------------|---------|
| Cash amount   | $2,500  |
| Period        | 16      |
| Interest rate | 0.57%   |

To conclude, to determine the current value of future fixed payments, we will solve the present value of an annuity by considering the future payments, interest rate, period, and the period compounding.
